for: Betty McKenzie, NAEB Newsletter
from: Alabama Educational TV Commission
Lou Peneguy, Director, Coordination and Information
RESUME: NAEB Region II Conference
1^5 NAEB Region II members attended the April 21-22 conference
at The Hotel Thomas Jefferson, Birmingham, Alabama.
Regional Director Raymond Hurlbert, General Manager, Alabama
ETV Commission (network), proclaimed the attendees composed one
of the most earnest, eager-to-learn groups with which he has ever
worked.
Saturdayâ€™s ETV session was divided into three general banquet
meetings and four specialized discussion units.
NAEB President William Harley addressed the organization at
breakfast. He described present aims and future goals of the
Association.
KTCA-TV General Manager John Schwarzwalder delivered the Mountain
Brook County Club luncheon,address. While praising the members
presents for taking their weekend to attend the conference, he also
challenged theecrowd to do the daring, exciting and experimental in
ETV "dispite limited budgets and small staffs". He maintained that
"the NAEB has the potiental of having 10,000 members" and that "it
can develop into one of the most influenical educational a^socations
in the worId."
CBS Public Affairs Director David Lowe (CBS Reports, Producer)
told the dinner audience that ETV stations have endless program
material in the cultural and civic affairs fields for Which create
adult programming.
